devdoc.details: The State Commitment Chain (SCC) contract contains a list of proposed state roots which Proposers assert to be a result of each transaction in the Canonical Transaction Chain (CTC). Elements here have a 1:1 correspondence with transactions in the CTC, and should be the unique state root calculated off-chain by applying the canonical transactions one by one. Runtime target: EVM

params._shouldStartAtElement: Index of the element at which this batch should start.
Index of the element at which this batch should start.

returns._0: Reference to the batch storage container.

params._batchHeader: Header of the batch to start deleting from.
Header of the batch to start deleting from.
Header of the batch to check.

returns._inside: Whether or not the batch is inside the fraud proof window.

params._batchHeader: Header of the batch to check.

returns._inside: Whether or not the batch is inside the fraud proof window.

params._name: Name to resolve an address for.

returns._0: Address associated with the given name.

params._batchHeader: Header of the batch in which the element was included.
params._element: Hash of the element to verify a proof for.
params._proof: Merkle inclusion proof for the element.

params._batchHeader: Header of the batch in which the element was included.

params._proof: Merkle inclusion proof for the element.

devdoc.title: StateCommitmentChain

appendStateBatch(bytes32[],uint256).notice: Appends a batch of state roots to the chain.

appendStateBatchByChainId(uint256,bytes3.notice: Appends a batch of state roots to the chain.

deleteStateBatch((uint256,bytes32,uint25.notice: Deletes all state roots after (and including) a given batch.

deleteStateBatchByChainId(uint256,(uint2.notice: Deletes all state roots after (and including) a given batch.

getLastSequencerTimestamp().notice: Retrieves the timestamp of the last batch submitted by the sequencer.

getLastSequencerTimestampByChainId(uint2.notice: Retrieves the timestamp of the last batch submitted by the sequencer.

getTotalBatches().notice: Retrieves the total number of batches submitted.

getTotalBatchesByChainId(uint256).notice: Retrieves the total number of batches submitted.

getTotalElements().notice: Retrieves the total number of elements submitted.

getTotalElementsByChainId(uint256).notice: Retrieves the total number of elements submitted.

insideFraudProofWindow((uint256,bytes32,.notice: Checks whether a given batch is still inside its fraud proof window.

insideFraudProofWindowByChainId(uint256,.notice: Checks whether a given batch is still inside its fraud proof window.

resolve(string).notice: Resolves the address associated with a given name.
